climbs.name: Semper Gumby
climbs.fa: Aaron Collins, Bob Pettit, Nate Gomez

content.description: Starts left of Lightning Strike. Follows dihedrAL past 2 bolts through a roof to a right leaning hand crack Past 1 bolt on to chans
content.protection: Set of nuts doubles to #3 BD

content.description: P1. 5.8 Start left of Boulder and follow cracks to two bolt anchor. P2. 5.10a  Traverse right to obvious crack With a bolt in a dihedral, work up to a roof with a bolt, then join the final crack of Peace Frog to 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack and a number four With bolted anchors
content.location: Just downstream from Nght's Watch and upstream from Peace Frog in the center of the Waerfall Area

content.description: Pitch one: start in corner on ledge above large boulder. Step up, then left into crack splitting face. Crack starts thin, then to fingers and hand size with jugs to good rests on way up crack to ledge with 2 bolt anchor, 50 ft., 5.9, small to med cams and nuts.   Pitch two: Climb easy ground toward hand crack, climb hand crack crux, solid 5.10 to awkward stance, then traverse left to easier wide crack, look for two bolt anchor above to right as you exit wide crack, 5.10, 75ft, cams for finger size through fist, two #4 bd are useful.climbing this as one pitch would probably result in excess rope drag, besides, take your time and enjoy the view.
content.location: Above large boulder, across creek from waterfall.need to do easy scramble to ledge from boulder to start of climb.

content.description: Start at base of right angling crack. step up and make a few moves up to gain jugs, then work your way right, following obvious crack. The boulder to your right is off - using it downgrades the difficulty and enjoyment. The challenge of this route is in making blind gear placements in the crux area. Due to the shortness of the route and the angle of the crack, a fall would be bad unless you sew up the gear. Two bolts finish the route to a two bolt anchor. A really fun, technical climb.
content.protection: BD sizes: two 0.3's, two 0.5's, two 0.75's, and two quick draws.
content.location: Just past canyoneers wall as canyon narrows there is a short wall to your left. You will see a nice, straight  hand crack (High water), and a right angling finger crack (Path of Totality). Scramble to nice ledge just below climbs.

climbs.name: The Night's Watch
climbs.fa: Aaron Collins, Bob Pettit, Daylon Robinaugh

content.description: Starts above the creek. Step off boulders and climb hand crack in the back of a shallow dihedral to a ledge. Step left and follow crack system to anchors. P2 head to obvious dihedral to anchors at the top.

climbs.name: Lightning Strike
climbs.fa: Bob Pettit, Aarons Collins, Manny Rangel

content.description: Climbs the obvious lightning bolt loozing crack.    Starts on the upper teir. Climb dihedral through a roof.
Ascent obvious crack from ledge. Some nice hand jams and plenty of jugs along the way. Short but good.
content.protection: BD sizes: one 0.3, two 0.75's, one #1, two #2's, one #3
content.location: Just past canyoneers wall as canyon narrows there is a short wall to your left. You will see a nice, straight  hand crack (High water), and a right angling finger crack (Path of Totality). Scramble to nice ledge just below climbs.

content.description:
Pitch 1 :  5.9  From atop the same bolder where “Semper Gumby” starts, head up left leaning corner to ledge with large boulder. Continue straight up corner with a good finger crack that is slightly hidden, and head left to follow black dihedral up to a traverse right avoiding broken overhung rock to a two bolt anchor.  Two bolts, small to medium gear. 95’

 Pitch 2 :  5.8  Continue up and to the left past a small tree, then a short dihedral section to a top out on the left.  Two bolts and small gear. 55’
content.protection: Nuts, and singles of cams from 5/16”- 2” with an extra BD #.75 and #1 equivalent. Alpine draws and a couple 4’ runners.
content.location: Same start as “Semper Gumby”, then heads up and left.

content.description: Upstream of Canyoneers wall and Southern wall - a few minutes and a bit of boulder hopping. This area is defined by walls around the waterfall where the creek takes a bend. Beautiful and shady.
